title: Cyber Guidance Website with Scam Education, User Login, and Scam Reports

requirements.text: Create a multi-page cyber guidance website with the following user-facing sections: (1) Home page explaining the site purpose, (2) Scam Guidance section that educates users about common cyber scams and bank-transaction fraud, (3) "What to do / How to help" guidance section with clear steps for victims and helpers, and (4) a Scam Reports section where users can submit and view scam incidents (what type of scam happened).

quotes: Make me a website which will tell us about any type of cyber scam or bank transaction... Make a cyber guidance like website... and add pages in the website like home page... and list of scams which type of scam has happened with you.

acceptanceCriteria: Navigation exists to access Home, Guidance, Help/Reporting, and Scam Reports sections.
All user-facing text is in English.
Scam Guidance includes at least: phishing, OTP/UPI fraud, fake customer care, card skimming, investment/crypto scams, job/loan scams, and social media impersonation.
Help/Reporting page includes step-by-step actions (e.g., secure accounts, preserve evidence, contact bank, report to relevant authorities) presented in a clear checklist format.

requirements.text: Implement user authentication UI with a dedicated Login/Register page and logged-in state, using the platform-supported identity mechanism, and gate scam report submission so only signed-in users can submit new reports.

quotes: add pages in the website like home page, login or register page

acceptanceCriteria: A Login/Register page exists and allows the user to sign in and sign out.
When signed out, the Scam Reports submission form is disabled/hidden and a clear prompt to log in is shown.
When signed in, the user can access the scam report submission form.

requirements.text: Create a Scam Reports feature where signed-in users can submit a scam incident including: scam type (selected from predefined categories), short title, description, approximate date, and optional loss amount; and all users can browse a list of submitted reports with basic filtering by scam type.

quotes: list of scams which type of scam has happened with you

acceptanceCriteria: Submission validates required fields (scam type, title, description) and shows user-friendly errors.
After submitting a report, it appears in the list without a full page refresh.
Scam report list supports filtering by scam type.
Each report shows: scam type, title, date reported, and a short preview of description.

requirements.text: Implement backend storage and retrieval for scam reports, including associating each report with the submitting user identity and a server-side timestamp; provide APIs for creating a report and listing reports (with optional scam-type filter).

quotes: list of scams which type of scam has happened with you

acceptanceCriteria: Backend persists reports across sessions and can return them on reload.
Each stored report includes: unique id, author identity, createdAt timestamp, and the submitted fields.
List endpoint supports filtering by scam type (or equivalent).

requirements.text: Add a consistent, distinctive visual theme suitable for a student cyber guidance project (avoid default/unstyled look): define a cohesive color palette (not blue/purple), typography hierarchy, spacing, and components (cards, nav, forms) and apply it across all pages.
acceptanceCriteria: All pages share consistent layout, typography, and component styling.
Theme uses a coherent palette that is not primarily blue/purple.
Forms, navigation, and lists are clearly readable and accessible (sufficient contrast, clear focus states).

requirements.text: Add a Resources section (within the Guidance or Help page) that lists general-purpose items users can use to get help: what evidence to collect, how to contact their bank, and how to find official cybercrime reporting channels for their region (without hardcoding country-specific phone numbers unless provided by the user).

quotes: if someone commits a crime related to scams then how can we help the people

acceptanceCriteria: Resources content includes evidence checklist (screenshots, transaction IDs, chat logs, URLs, phone numbers) and safety reminders.
Copy avoids claiming to be official law enforcement and advises users to use official channels for their location.
No country-specific emergency/cybercrime numbers are included unless the user supplies them.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or the immutable hook/actor files listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose them from app code instead.
No third-party authentication providers; use the platform-supported identity flow only.
No external databases or non-supported backend runtimes (e.g., Python/Node) despite the userâ€™s original preference.
nonGoals: Real-time chat or live incident response.
Integration with police/bank APIs, ticketing systems, SMS/email sending, or push notifications.
Automatic scam detection or AI-generated analysis of reports.
Collecting sensitive banking credentials/OTP/PIN; the UI must not ask for such secrets.

required: Minimal cyber safety emblem/logo with shield + circuit lines (cyber-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Wide hero illustration showing abstract secure banking + warning symbols in a warm non-blue palette (hero-cyber-guidance.dim_1600x900.png)
